title: Watched a friend play vs a Zed
body:
He's low Silver and complains about Zed/LB/Ahri constantly.

He was playing {{champion:63}}.

Didn't take {{summoner:3}} 

Was building a {{item:3136}} instead of a {{item:3191}}.

Both teams fought at dragon, trading 1v1 but he got chunked out to like 40% while his lane opponent was almost unscathed. He returns to return to lane and gets dove by the Zed. The Zed plays the dive fucking horribly, wasting his shadow and landing his E+Q but forgetting his Cuitlass. 

But you know what? Brand played it worse because he had no armor (30ish),  missed his Stun and no Exhaust and decided to stay when he was low.

It's why I can't take Zed QQers seriously. Because it's people like this who choose not to take a great SS to counter him, refuse to build resistances, fuck up in the actual game and just blame the champ.

{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

lolwut. As long as you exhaust before the ult pops, zed's damage gets gimped hard.

What is the cooldown on Exhaust? What is the cooldown on Zed's ult?

This is akin to taking Cleanse to counter Taric.

With one point in his ult, Death Mark is 120 second cooldown. Exhaust's cooldown is 210 seconds. So you can use Exhaust on Zed once every other ult up-time. And while this seems bad that you'll only be able to use it half the time on him, its better than nothing. A good Zed will try and kill his low-mobility opponent shortly after he hits 6, and if you have exhaust, that's going to pretty much shut down his attempt. Its not like any other option would be better, ignite doesn't help you defensively, especially this early in the game when no one has much life steal. Heal is going to be cut by Zed's exhaust(EDIT: sorry, meant Zed's Ignite). Exhaust is a good option, especially considering you probably won't have much besides Doran's Ring and maybe a Seeker's arm guard if you are farming well.

tl;dr: Exhaust helps against the early aggression Zed is capable of once he has his ult. If you are playing a squishy, immobile mage and you aren't confident, Exhaust can help you out. Its better than the alternatives Ignite and Heal. It cuts Zed's ult damage tremendously.

The thing is no energy champ has real costs if they use their kit correctly. Zed is no different. When I have forced Zed to be defensive or even baited out his abilities he runs out of energy nonstop.

The problem people have with zed isn't his OH HE JUMPED ON ME AND KILLED ME WHILE HE WAS 27/0.

It's because he has:
Cheap escapes
Good waveclear
Fast regen/infinite energy (so ability use is continual)
Cheap harrass
Easy dives
Easy escapes
AND the ability to blow up a single squishy target

The combination results in a champion that can push, waveclear, and poke all at the same time despite being melee, can't be ganked by the jungler to punish for pushing, and once he gets you low enough can just turret dive you with his ult... and then walk away from it.

It's the same reason people complain about lee-it's not because of any single item in his kit, it's the overloading combination that results in a champion that's overpowered and is painfully obvious.

The fact that Zed forces opponents to itemize in very specific fashion (zhonyas) and practically forces you to take exhaust just to survive laning vs him speaks volumes. Its hard to think of any other champion that mandates such choices vs them. And thats just to survive the lane lol, not even win it.

These are not arguments to make if you want to claim that Zed is balanced. You are actually making the case he is Op.

Characters I take exh against mid (as squishy immobile casters like Xerath):

Annie, Veigar (rip though), Yasuo, Zed, Diana, Ahri, Kennen... And that's just off the top of my head. Exhaust is a great summoner spell when you're playing against an assassin or burst mage, as it prevents them from being able to safely all-in you early on in the game. It's not that Zed is so overpowered that you HAVE to take exhaust, it's that squishy immobile casters HAVE to take a defensive summoner spell to fight against assassins and burst mages in mid at the moment.

Zhonya's being a choice item against him doesn't mean it's a requirement.
A good mid can focus more on csing and harass and prevent Zed from ever getting into a good spot to ult in the first place.
Taking Exhaust over Ignite says you're not worried about kills, but focused on getting your gold and pushing for the mid game where mages excel at team fights. 
It's also worth pointing out, this game is meant to be played strategically, meaning you should adjust your play style and build for EVERY opponent.  The fact that Zed forces people to play in a specific fashion, the fact that they can't simply rush Morello then deathcap then stacking AP like they would against countless other match ups speaks to the level of strategy that Zed forces people to use.  If more champs could force you to actually think on the fly, adjust your strategy and plan out your build instead of rushing the same build every match, then this game would be so much better.

I understand why people think OP exaggerated; however, I can attest that this scenario does happen, and quite frequently too.

As a somewhat-frequent Zed player myself, most of my kills come not from my own ability, but instead from my opponents screwing up. It is difficult to spot one's own mistakes while playing the game, so OP's friend probably was not even aware of how much he misplayed.

When laning against Zed, get a Zhonyas early, don't push to his wave, and don't waste mana.

A Zhonyas can negate his entire combo, allowing you to turn the fight. Staying within tower range means that he has to have ult in order to kill you, and conserving mana will allow you fight back when he all-ins you.

Most mages, unfortunately, have to use mana to waveclear safely against a Zed, and rushing Seeker's, while a great defensive strategy, really hinders your ability to push back your lane, something Zed can do almost for free.

Not an ideal item, but {{item:3070}} 720 gold, fairly easy to get and quickly makes mana problems a thing of the past.
Only issue is not an ideal item on all mages.  It does however help with the wave clear issue, then getting a seekers helps with defense, and once Luden's Echo comes out, wave clear issues really will be a lot less of an issue.
Wait, so am I supposed to get {{item:3070}} or {{item:3191}} against Zed? After all, that together is 1920 gold... by that point Zed already has {{item:3144}} {{item:1001}}

You don't have to.
But it is an option.
If you don't feel you can keep Zed harassed out of going in and trying to trade or poke you down while you cs, then it's definitely an decent option.

Well my point was that most mages (other than those who have some mana regain in their kit -- {{champion:90}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:4}} ) would ordinarily go for a mana or mana-regen item first, because since the nerfs, those items are necessary in laning phase. Often a {{item:3114}} or {{item:3070}} .

Against a Zed, it's risky if you don't buy a {{item:3191}} and rush it into a {{item:3157}} .

TF can rush Zhonya's, but most mages cannot, or they won't be able to compete with Zed's waveclear. And either way, while the mage is spending 2000g on these necessary defensive/mana items, Zed is free to rush his BOTRK and his Brutalizer.

It pushes home a point that many people seem to not realize.
Mages are meh in laning phase.  Assassins are meh in lane until they get their ults, at which point they gain significant dueling potential which mages simply aren't designed to be able to counter.

Short of playing safe, harassing from a distance and csing near perfectly, a mage is simply going to struggle against an assassin in lane by sheer virtue of how their kits work.  Shy of gutting all assassins or overbuffing mages to the point of being godly, there's not much you can really do against this.
Well, that's assuming that you don't have a mobile mage ... {{champion:103}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:7}}

LB and Fizz could be considered mages due to their AoE, but truthfully they fulfill the assassin archetype much better.

Ahri is good, she's a lot safer against assassins due to her mobility, though it's really a skill match up as to whether she would simply survive lane or get kills on any assassin opponent.

Good post. There is no reason not to get Zhonya's early against a Zed. Its already a coveted item for any AP user. Normally champions wouldn't want to build it first because the armor stat isn't helpful in lane phase against an AP opponent, but Zed is AD, so its ideal.

Even if the player wants to rush some mana sustain first(like a Morellonomicon), I still think its a good idea to at least get Seeker's and finish Zhonya's second ASAP.

The real problem with assassins, though, is how easily they stomp solo queue. I can hold my lane without dying, and ping MIAs, and my bot lane will still feed my Leblanc or Zed a double.

Like, if he gets stunned right after death mark and Q'd and then you zhonya's the mark and he doesn't jump back to shadow and run away (or you didn't run away from his initial shadow, either) and he just gets stunned/combo'd again.

People dont understand that rushing seeker's gimps the vast majority of AP mids in the game, and while it may help you survive the poke, you are probably going to lose the lane because Zed will just out-sustain your mana pool. The only way seeker's really helps is if your jungler watches enough LCS to give you the 2nd blue like the pro's, so you dont need an early morello or athene's. But, you dont generally get a blue in solo Q, and then you are at an extreme disadvantage vs zed with maybe a doran's ring for mana sustain.

I think more people watch LCS than play the game, and just talk out of their ass about balance issues. Hell, even in LCS Zed has like a 80% win-rate, and they get the 2nd blues every single time to pretty much make rushing armguard the smartest thing to do. Then, your average silver player goes into ranked, rushes armguard, has zero mana regen, gets bullied and pushed in by zed and doesnt have the ability to clear the waves, eats more poke, doesnt have the mana to fight back, and loses lane just as horribly, but slower than rushing seekers.

The bottom line is you shouldnt have to rush a seekers and completely gimp your entire early game just because its Zed, while Zed NEVER has to rush, say a hexdrinker, and generally does his same build regardless of what he is facing or doing. It might be different if seekers countered zed, but it doesn't.

So rush a Haunting Guise instead? I'm guessing the Brand in OP already had a mana item and still wasn't building Seeker's. There's having to get a mana regen item early, and then there's already having it and still not buying a great counter to Zed.

And yes, I said counter, because while Seeker's only gives you the armor, Zhonya's is the real prize. Zhonya's active can completely negate the damage from Zed's ult with good timing. Add to that the armor and AP you get, and its a really nice item for any mage to have.

It just keeps death mark from gibbing you. I dunno why people think zed can't kill people 1on1 without death mark; once he gets a few items he can kill them without it.

I dont agree with rushing a haunting guise, but thats besides the point. My point is rushing a seekers puts you at a disadvantage in lane, unless you are getting blue buffs ala LCS, and we all know you aren't getting any early blue buffs in ranked.

And it doesnt counter zed. Why the hell do you people keep thinking seeker's counters zed? It just makes him deal a little less damage to you; that pissy amount of armor doesn't counter anything; it just lets you not get poked out and all-in'd as fast. Every zed gets an early brutalizer anyways. Seekers is still a damned if you do, damned if you dont item. You dont counter anything he does with a seekers. You slightly mitigate it, at the cost of being able to clear waves/fight back, which has its own set of problems.

No one is arguing that zhonyas isnt a required item vs zed, or a great item for any mage. Having to rush it when facing a basically resourceless champion like zed, on what are typically mana-gated champs, basically sucks. Again, this is mitigated by getting blue buffs, but you never get blue buffs in solo Q. You have all these selfish trick2g "this is my jungle" wannabe's running around hogging up all the buffs for 35 minutes, and you are put at a disadvantage.

Some champions will want to get a mana item first. I'll admit that. But why not get Zhonya's second? A Deathcap is an even more valuable purchase when you already have a few AP items, so its ok not to get it second. Void Staff in general is not needed early (sometimes on certain champs you might want to pick it up early, but just in general) and can be bought later, particularly against a Zed, which as many in this thread are saying, doesn't buy a great deal of MR usually. 

My main point is (and I think what OP's main point is too) that if you are having trouble vs. a Zed, or think you will have trouble, there are ways to strategize against him. Seeker's and Zhonya's are one of those ways. If I were Brand and I was doing poorly against that Zed, I'd probably want a Seeker's early just so I hopefully wouldn't feed Zed to beyond the point of my team being able to pick up my slack. Its a better strategy than doing nothing and going back to "business as usual" build. More AP is not going to stop me(in any way even slow me) from handing Zed kills. If that Brand is not confident and getting frustrated, he should get a Seeker's or at least the Needlessly Large Rod that will eventually become Zhonya's.

I would think that a guy who gets +% AD and a damage multiplier on his ultimate would be some slow guy like Darius; not someone that can blip back to under his own turret after facerolling his keyboard; but I'm glad Riot Games proved me otherwise.  My only complaint about Zed is how safe he is.  I don't think shadows should last as long as they do so that a Zed has to decide faster between securing a kill and making a quick escape.

Zed is a problem. Theoretically, he is a perfect assassin. Lots of mobility and excellent burst, but counter able by many things. In practice... Well, when you have champions who use a meaningful resource for their spells and those who do not in a same lane, it turns out about how'd you expect. So this guy can not only assassinate you, but also outpush, outpoke, outfarm and outsustain you.  Just hit his energy costs or minion damage and he's fine.

I could counter-build a Zed all day, doesn't stop him from roaming bot and picking up easy kills. I dont ban Zed in rank though since my ranked elo is so low that 90% of the zed players suck. Really depends on elo i guess. i mean he is annoying to lane against him but i do okay with annie if i rush zhonyas the armor plus her E works well against him however, i dont feel like he should be able to farm as easily and as safely as he does now. Overall, nowhere near the elo to care about Zeds but mechanically i can see how he can do well.
But if I get Zhonya's then I can't get Rabadon's and faceroll the early game.... :(

Well they gutted mordekaiser, who was my number one option when the enemy picked zed.... SO yeah, I will be banning the mofo from now on.
We have a champ that has, great split pushing and farming ability, extreme burst damage.  Ability to execute people under tower. And on top of all that , good mobility and the ability to escape ganks... He doesn't really have much of a weakness at all.  And this is especially true after they nerfed mana mages.
